alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 21 at 5:24AM CST until January 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County. For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Duck River Near Hurricane Mills. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Agricultural land, other low lying areas, and access points along the river from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville Rd begin to flood. Portions of Tumbling Creek Rd east of Highway 13 begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 18.3 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.5 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 800 AM CST.
